references.reason: This book is a foundational text in causal inference, providing a comprehensive framework for understanding and analyzing causal relationships.

references.paper_title: Causal inference using the algorithmic Markov condition
references.reason: This paper introduces the Algorithmic Markov Condition (AMC), a key theoretical concept underlying the paper's approach to causal discovery.
This book provides a comprehensive overview of the Minimum Description Length (MDL) principle, which the paper leverages to make the problem of causal discovery computationally tractable.

references.paper_title: Investigating causal relations by econometric models and cross-spectral methods
references.reason: This seminal paper introduces Granger causality, a statistical concept that forms a baseline for many causal discovery methods and is discussed in relation to the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Spectra of some self-exciting and mutually exciting point processes
references.reason: This paper introduces Hawkes processes, a type of point process that is widely used to model temporal dependencies in event data, which this paper builds upon and extends.
